title: Restore colorful earthy green and warm amber visual theme

requirements.summary: Define vivid, saturated OKLCH color tokens for earthy green (primary) and warm amber (accent) palette in global styling files
acceptanceCriteria: `--primary` or equivalent CSS token resolves to a deep, saturated green visible on white backgrounds.
`--accent` or equivalent CSS token resolves to a vivid amber/golden color.
Tailwind config extends theme with these tokens so utility classes like `bg-primary`, `text-accent`, `border-primary` produce colorful results.
Dark-mode tokens (if defined) also use saturated variants of the same palette.

file_operations.description: Replace existing OKLCH color token values with vivid, saturated earthy green (primary) and warm amber (accent) colors. Update --primary to a deep forest green (e.g., OKLCH 0.45 0.15 150), --accent to a golden amber (e.g., OKLCH 0.70 0.15 70), and ensure all semantic tokens (--background, --foreground, --muted, --card, --border) use rich, distinguishable values. Apply the same palette to dark mode variants with adjusted lightness for visibility.

Extend the theme colors section to map CSS custom properties (--primary, --accent, etc.) to Tailwind utility classes. Ensure bg-primary, text-primary, border-primary, bg-accent, text-accent produce vivid green and amber colors respectively. Add additional semantic color mappings (muted, card, border) that reference the updated OKLCH tokens from index.css.

requirements.summary: Apply the restored earthy green and warm amber color palette across all frontend pages and components
acceptanceCriteria: The top navigation bar uses a rich earthy green background with contrasting amber or white text.
Primary action buttons use saturated green or amber fill colors, not grey or white.
Card containers have visible colored borders or colored header bands using the green/amber palette.
Status badges (Pending, Approved, Rejected) are rendered in distinct, vivid colors (e.g. amber for pending, green for approved, red for rejected).
Form field focus states and labels use green or amber accent colors.
The Manager Dashboard stat cards use colorful backgrounds or colored icons from the earthy green/amber palette.
All pages are visually consistent with each other using the same color tokens.
No page appears grey, white-only, or colorless.

file_operations.description: Update the header/navigation bar to use a rich earthy green background (bg-primary or a saturated green shade) with contrasting white or amber text. Ensure the logout button uses an amber or green accent color for visual richness.

Update badge styling to use vivid, distinct colors: amber/golden yellow for pending status, saturated green for approved, and red for rejected. Ensure each badge stands out visually using the restored palette.

Apply colorful styling: use green or amber borders on the form card, green/amber labels and focus states for input fields, and a saturated green or amber primary button for the 'Register Agent' action. Ensure the page is visually rich, not monochrome.

Apply colorful styling: use green or amber borders on the card and tab selectors, green/amber focus states on inputs, and saturated green or amber primary buttons for 'Login with Agent ID' and 'Login with Phone'. Ensure tabs and buttons reflect the earthy green/amber palette.

Apply colorful styling: use green or amber header bands or colored borders on the welcome banner and action cards. Ensure quick-action cards use colorful icons or backgrounds from the green/amber palette. Make the dashboard visually vibrant.

Apply colorful styling: use green or amber borders on the form card, green/amber labels and focus states for all input fields, and a saturated green or amber primary button for 'Submit eKYC Application'. Ensure the form is visually rich and consistent with the palette.

Apply colorful styling: use a green or amber header band or colored border on the acknowledgment card, and green/amber accent colors for action buttons ('Submit Another Application', 'Check Application Status'). Ensure the acknowledgment number display is visually prominent.

Apply colorful styling: use green or amber borders on the search card and application details card, green/amber focus states on the input field, and a saturated green or amber primary button for 'Check Status'. Ensure the displayed application details use the StatusBadge with vivid colors.

Apply colorful styling: use green or amber borders on the login card, green/amber focus states on inputs, and saturated green or amber primary buttons for 'Request OTP' and 'Verify OTP'. Ensure the manager login page is visually consistent with the earthy green/amber palette.

Apply colorful styling: use colorful backgrounds or colored icons on stat cards (total/pending agents and applications) using the green/amber palette. Apply green or amber borders or header bands to navigation cards. Ensure the dashboard is visually rich and vibrant.

Apply colorful styling: use green or amber borders on the agent list card, green/amber buttons for 'Approve' and 'Reject' actions, and ensure the status badges use vivid colors. Make the agent list visually consistent with the restored palette.

Apply colorful styling: use green or amber borders on the application list card, green/amber buttons for 'Approve' and 'Reject' actions, and ensure the status badges use vivid colors. Make the application list visually rich and consistent with the earthy green/amber palette.

Apply colorful styling: use green or amber borders on the form card, green/amber labels and focus states for input fields, and a saturated green or amber primary button for 'Create Agent Account'. Ensure the success message and copy-to-clipboard button use accent colors from the palette.
